010package imagingbook.common.geometry.mappings.linear;
011
012import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
013
014/**
015 * This class represents a pure 2D rotation about the coordinate origin 
016 * (as a special case of affine mapping).
017 * It can be assumed that every instance of this class is indeed a rotation.
018 */
019public class Rotation2D extends AffineMapping2D {
020        
021        /**
022         * Constructor. Creates a 2D rotation by a given
023         * angle about the origin.
024         * @param alpha rotation angle (in radians)
025         */
026        public Rotation2D(double alpha) {
027                super(
028                         Math.cos(alpha), -Math.sin(alpha), 0,
029                         Math.sin(alpha),  Math.cos(alpha), 0);
030        }
031        
032        /**
033         * Auxiliary constructor used internally for duplicating instances.
034         * @param a00 matrix element A_00
035         * @param a01 matrix element A_01
036         * @param a10 matrix element A_10
037         * @param a11 matrix element A_11
038         */
039        protected Rotation2D(double a00, double a01, double a10, double a11) {
040                super(a00, a01, 0, a10, a11, 0);
041        }
042        
043        /**
044         * Constructor. 
045         * Creates a new {@link Rotation2D} object from an existing instance.
046         * @param m a {@link Rotation2D} instance
047         */
048        public Rotation2D(Rotation2D m) {
049                this(m.a00, m.a01, m.a10, m.a11);
050        }
051        
052        // ----------------------------------------------------------
053        
054        /**
055         * Concatenates this rotation (A) with another rotation (B) and returns
056         * a new rotation (C), such that C(x) = B(A(x)).
057         * @param B the second rotation
058         * @return the concatenated rotations
059         */
060        public Rotation2D concat(Rotation2D B) {
061                double[][] C = Matrix.multiply(B.getTransformationMatrix(), this.getTransformationMatrix());
062                return new Rotation2D(C[0][0], C[0][1], C[1][0], C[1][1]);
063        }
064        
065        @Override
066        public Rotation2D duplicate() {
067                return new Rotation2D(this);
068        }
069        
070        @Override
071        public Rotation2D getInverse() {
072                return new Rotation2D(a00, -a01, -a10, a11);
073        }
074
075}
076
077
